info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 1:51AM EDT until April 09 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Lincoln. In central South Carolina, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCormick, Lincolnton, Elijah Clark State Park, Mccormick County Airport, Parksville, Plum Branch, Hawe Creek Campground, Baker Creek State Park, Hickory Knob State Resort Park, Long Cane Creek Picnic Area, Bordeaux, New Hope, Knox Scout Reservation, Curry Hill, Loce and Whitetown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in the advisory area. Turn around, don`t drown.
